title: R42476
content: The Financial Services and General Government (FSGG) appropriations bill includes funding for various government agencies, including the Department of the Treasury and the Executive Office of the President. The President's request for FY2013 includes creating a new bureau, the Fiscal Service, to streamline functions and reduce duplication. The FSGG appropriations bill provides funding for the Executive Office of the President, the judiciary, and the District of Columbia. The President's FY2013 budget requests include decreases for the EOP, an increase for the judiciary, and an increase for special federal payments to the District. Title V of the FSGG appropriations bill provides funding for independent agencies such as GSA, SEC, and USPS. The President's FY2013 budget request includes $24.05 billion for these agencies, an increase of $159 million from FY2012 levels.
